member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Customization.CustomizationSection
member.summary: Autodesk.AutoCAD.Customization.CustomizationSection ClassThis class represents the root element of the CUI file. This element contains the HeaderSection and MenuGroup elements, as well as methods for file operations. To open a CUI file, the full path to the file should be passed to the CustomizationSection constructor.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Customization.CustomizationSection.CloneMenuMacro(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Customization.MenuMacro,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clone a macro from a different file. If a macro already exists in this file with the same Name and Command, it will be re-used. If useSimilarMacro is set to true, a Macro with the same command string will be re-used even if other attributes are slightly different. Legacy features will only re-use macros from other legacy features and only if the name and command match exactly. If useSimilarMacro is set to false, a macro will not be re-used unless one can be found with the same Name and Command.
member.param: The macro to duplicate.
Sets whether to re-use existing macros with the same Command string.
member.returns: MenuMacro if found or newly created MenuMacro if cloned.

member.summary: Returns the MenuMacro object (a Command in the CUI dialog) associated with the macroId.
member.param: Id of the macro to search for.
member.returns: MenuMacro object (a Command in the CUI dialog) associated with the macroId.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Customization.MenuAccelerator.AcceleratorShortcutKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a string representing the shortcut key combination. Sets the key combination based on the given string. The string must be in the form of "SHIFT+CTRL+ALT+X" where "X" is a valid character or virtual key string. "SHIFT", "CTRL" and "ALT" must be separated by "+" but can be in any order and can use either the global (English) or the localized value. See the AutoCAD Customization Guide for valid character combinations and virtual keys. An ArgumentOutOfRangeException can be thrown if the string is not properly formatted or not a valid character combination.

member.summary: Evaluates a DIESEL expression string to provide the actual text that would appear. Most applications will simply return the dieselExpression string. However, if this string is used in a UI application, it may be necessary to evaluate this to a readable string.
member.param: A DIESEL expression string.
member.returns: The actual text that would appear.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Customization.IHostServices.RegistryProductRootKey
member.summary: If provided, AcCui.dll can modify settings for menus and toolbars in the registry. This method may return null. If the default implementation returns null, changes to menus and toolbars will not be reflected in the current profile.
member.returns: The product root Key in the registry.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Customization.IHostServices.DisplayMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method is called for messages that would normally appear in a dialog box. It is up to the host application to determine if a dialog box is appropriate. If showMessageBox is set to false when the CustomizationSection is created, this function will not be called. Instead, all messages will go to WriteMessage().
member.param: Message to display.
Title for the dialog box.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Customization.IHostServices.WriteMessage(System.String)
member.summary: These are less critical messages that would normally be printed to the AutoCAD command line. If showMessageBox is set to false when the CustomizationSection is created, this function will receive all messages.
member.param: Message to display.

member.summary: Host applications should always return false.
member.returns: false.

member.returns: Files that are passed in with a relative path.
